drupalNodeEvent.title: “China–India Relations: A Source of Rising Concern?”

field_speakers.processed: Anna Stirr (University of Hawai'i at Mānoa); Andrea Malji (Hawaii Pacific University), Yong Jae Kim (Hawaii Pacific University)

field_organizers.processed: University of Hawai'i at Mānoa Center for Chinese Studies, University of Hawai'i at Mānoa Department of Asian Studies & Center for South Asian Studies, Hawaii Pacific University Departments of History and International Studies

field_description.processed: The University of Hawai'i at Mānoa Center for Chinese Studies presents a Faculty Roundtable to examine India and China’s policies toward one another and the sources of potential instability and conflict. This webinar features Assistant Professor Andrea Malji of Political Science, International Studies, and Diplomacy and Military studies at Hawaii Pacific University; Assistant Professor of Yong Jae Kim of political science and international studies at Hawaii Pacific University; and Associate Professor Anna Stirr of Asian Studies and Director of the Center for South Asian Studies at the University of Hawaii Manoa. This event is co-sponsored by the Office for Global Engagement, UHM Department of Asian Studies & Center for South Asian Studies, and HPU’s Departments of History and International Studies.
